glsa.title: MAN DB: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in MAN DB allows local users to gain root privileges.

background.p: MAN DB is a man replacement that utilizes BerkelyDB instead of flat files.

description.p: The /var/cache/man directory as part of the MAN DB package has group permissions set to root.

impact.p: A local user who does not belong to the root group, but has the ability to modify the /var/cache/man directory can escalate privileges to the group root.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All MAN DB users should upgrade to the latest version:
